name: River Trail
description: A bend in the River Trail, offering a glimpse of the river itself, murky and indifferent. You are on the River Trail, where a slight curve in the packed earth reveals a sliver of the river, its waters a murky brown, flowing with an indifferent current. The cottonwoods grow thicker here, their branches forming a canopy that filters the harsh afternoon sun, casting long, dappled shadows on the path. The air is heavy with the scent of river water and decaying leaves, a poignant reminder of time's relentless passage on the frontier.
